intro: Veronica anagallis-aquatica subsp. anagallidiformis, commonly known as the water speedwell, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its delicate blue or purple flowers and is typically found in moist or wet habitats such as streambanks and damp meadows. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family, which includes other species with similar floral structures. This subspecies is noted for its ability to thrive in aquatic or semi-aquatic environments.
